drinkName.name: Golden Gate Spritz
drinkName.about: Want to lighten up? Try this refreshing glass of amaro and grapefruit capped with bubbly.

mix.how: Add amaro and grapefruit juice to a coupe and top with chilled sparkling wine.
Garnish with grapefruit peel.

drinkName.name: Type Eh
drinkName.about: Canadian whisky teams up with earthy Cynar to create this burly coupe with a hint of smoked salt.

ingredients.ingredient: Forty Creek Barrel Select Canadian whisky

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe.

drinkName.name: Don Sherry
drinkName.about: Canadian whisky, mezcal and sherry combine to form a smooth, smoky trio in the glass.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass over ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: RCMPiña
drinkName.about: You’ll find whisky, spice and everything nice inside this tall glass of Canadian whisky, ginger syrup and Chinese bitters.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker over ice.
Shake, and strain over fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a piece of crystallized ginger.

drinkName.name: Autumn
drinkName.about: This fall-forward combination of pear brandy, applejack and sherry is versatile enough to be served cold or as a warm Toddy.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain over one large hand-carved ice cube.
Spray with allspice tincture, garnish with pear crisp and serve on a burning maple leaf.

drinkName.name: Pear & Elderflower Collins
drinkName.about: Pear puree and pear liqueur add a double dose of fall flavor to this bubbly highball.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except club soda to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain over fresh ice.
Top with club soda and stir.
Garnish with a slice of pear and grated cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Poached Pear & Ginger Daiquiri
drinkName.about: For super intense flavor, poach your pears in a simple syrup flavored with warming winter spices like clove, cinnamon and star anise.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a blender with a scoop of crushed ice.
Blend until smooth.

drinkName.name: Spiced Pear Bellini
drinkName.about: Need a last-minute fall cocktail? This four-ingredient stunner will satisfy any pear-loving party guests.

ingredients.ingredient: Tiny pinch of cinnamon and nutmeg

mix.how: Add all ingredients except sparkling wine to mixing glass with two ice cubes.
Add five ounces of sparkling wine.
Stir well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled glass.
Garnish with slice of pear.

drinkName.name: Falling Leaves
drinkName.about: Pear eau de vie and dry Riesling make natural mates in this gently spiced coupe.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into coupe.
Garnish with star anise.

drinkName.name: Apples & Pears
drinkName.about: Applejack, pear brandy and hard pear cider? That’s a perfect formula for autumn cocktail fans everywhere.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except hard pear cider to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain over fresh ice.
Top with hard pear cider.

drinkName.name: Spiced Cocoa
drinkName.about: Spice up your next cup of cocoa with this cayenne-spiked recipe mixed with nutty walnut liqueur and bourbon.

mix.how: Preheat mug by filling it with hot water.
Discard water after 30 seconds.
Add bourbon and walnut liqueur to the heated mug.
Add the spicy hot cocoa and gently mix together.
Garnish with chile peppers.

drinkName.name: Montgomerie Smoked Cider
drinkName.about: The formula for a perfectly balanced glass of fall flavor? Smoky Scotch, sweet cider and tart lemon juice.

ingredients.ingredient: Laphroaig 10 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a glass over ice.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Trilby
drinkName.about: A unique sherry-cask-mellowed gin adds depth and richness to this three-ingredient stunner.

ingredients.ingredient: Booth’s Finest Dry Gin Cask Mellowed

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a coupe.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Mother Flower
drinkName.about: Soju and Genepy, the traditional herbal liqueur, meet with Cocchi Americano to produce this earthy yet refreshing cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a glass rinsed with mezcal and absinthe over a large ice cube.
Garnish with an edible flower.

drinkName.name: Smoke House
drinkName.about: Lapsang tea lends its signature smokiness to this cocktail through an infused gin, which is balanced with bittersweet Cynar and Chartreuse.

mix.how: Add ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir, and strain into a glass.
Garnish with orange peel.

drinkName.name: Berry Barracuda
drinkName.about: Leave it to the pros at The Dead Rabbit to create a cocktail that pairs Irish whiskey with strawberries and tart balsamic vinegar. Lillet Rose and sherry complete this ingenious coupe.

ingredients.ingredient: Knappogue Castle Single Malt Irish Whiskey 12-Year

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a coupe.
Garnish with a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Rock Your Face Off Hot Toddy
drinkName.about: This Toddy is the perfect vehicle for Mister Katz’s Rock & Rye from New York Distilling Company. Combine the flavorful rye with honey syrup, lemon juice and bitters for a dram that will keep you warm all winter.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a Toddy or 6-ounce juice glass.
Add 3 ounces of hot water and stir.
Garnish with half a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Pumpkin Pie Brew
drinkName.about: Pumpkin fans will love this easy blend of pumpkin beer and freshly-brewed black tea laced with chai spices, coconut and pineapple.

mix.how: Combine ingredients in a chilled glass.
Garnish with fresh ginger.

drinkName.name: Apple Crisp Toddy
drinkName.about: Craving gooey apple crisp? Create the drinkable version with a base of freshly-brewed English breakfast tea laced with lemon peel plus spicy ginger bourbon, apple slices and cinnamon.

mix.how: Combine Owl’s Brew, bourbon, bitters, cinnamon stick and two apple slices in a saucepan and heat until warm, but do not boil.
Pour into a mug and garnish with fresh apple slices and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Cranberry Sauced
drinkName.about: This base of freshly brewed Darjeeling tea spiked with hibiscus, strawberry and lemon peel is a bright match for vodka and cranberry bitters.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig.
Combine all ingredients in a large shaker.
Add one cup of crushed ice and shake vigorously for five seconds.
Pour entire contents of shaker into a large tiki bowl.
Add two additional cups of ice and garnish tropically.

drinkName.name: French 75
drinkName.about: This bright and bubbly glass of gin, lemon juice, simple syrup and Champagne is a timeless classic for good reason.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except Champagne to an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously.
Uncap shaker and add Champagne.
Strain mixture into a Champagne glass and garnish with an expressed lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Barrel Finished Egg Nog
drinkName.about: Gin and cognac give this Egg Nog double the heft while a spiced syrup lends rich winter flavor.

mix.how: Add all ingredients into an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously (20-30 sec).
Double-strain into a 10-ounce rocks glass filled with fresh ice, and garnish with a star anise pod.

drinkName.name: Autumn Apple
drinkName.about: Autumn’s favorite flavor takes center stage in this festive glass of apple cider, gin, honey syrup and cinnamon.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously.
Double-strain into a coupe glass.
Express the oil from a lemon twist and garnish with the twist.

drinkName.name: Perfect Pear
drinkName.about: Fresh pear puree lends fall flavor to this bubbly blend of gin, elderflower liqueur and Champagne.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except Champagne to an ice-filled shaker and shake vigorously.
Double-strain into a 5.5-ounce coupe.
Top with a splash of Champagne and garnish with a fresh slice of pear.

drinkName.name: Local Option
drinkName.about: During his shift at Miami’s Broken Shaker, Alex Renshaw of Chicago’s Drumbar served this balanced blend of Bacardi 8 rum, bitter amaro, apple juice and Demerara syrup as a tribute to his home city’s brisk climate.

mix.how: Shake and strain on 1x1 cubes.

drinkName.name: A Famous Captain
drinkName.about: This cocktail is Vince Toscano’s ode to Miami’s Broken Shaker, where he was blown away by the high quality cocktail ingredients. Made with a combination of Bacardi Gran Reserva Maestro de Ron, cinnamon syrup, lime and pineapple juices and sweet vermouth, the Captain is a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.

ingredients.ingredient: Bacardí Gran Reserva Maestro de Ron

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker.
Shake and strain over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Final Judgment
drinkName.about: Made with gin, pear puree, lime juice and a hint of absinthe, the Final Judgment is John Codd’s nod to an original recipe from The Savoy Cocktail Book, the first cocktail book he ever touched.

drinkName.name: Goodnight Bern
drinkName.about: Caitlin Laman’s complex glass of Bacardi Gran Reserva, Fernet-Vallet, rich simple syrup and coffee bitters paid homage to her travels in Switzerland. During a visit to Bern, she spent each morning drinking strong Swiss coffee and each evening drinking local bitter liqueurs. The combination of the two led her to this unbeatable structure that works with just about every spirit out there.

drinkName.name: Brandy Crusta
drinkName.about: During his Bar Shift in New York City, Daniel Victory’s Brandy Crusta served as a reminder of his native New Orleans. The legendary cocktail was invented there and has been the base formula of countless other drinks that have inspired Victory since.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne Coupe with a sugar rim and garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: New Orleans: #RAD
drinkName.about: Pam Wiznitzer’s bubbly New Orleans: #RAD was inspired by her favorite moment during the annual Tales of the Cocktail convention. Following the last Tales event on Sunday night, the industry takes over a local bar and breaks out the sparkling rosé to the chant of “rosé all day.” Wiznitzer captured the energy of this moment with her specialty cocktail, made with cognac, St-Germain, strawberry puree and absinthe and topped with a float of sparkling rosé.

mix.how: Shake all ingredients except for the sparkling rosé.
Pour into a white wine glass.
Top with sparkling rosé.
Garnish with mini tiny rubber duckie.

drinkName.name: Spin Move
drinkName.about: One of Yael Vengroff’s signature Bar Shift hits, this warmly spiced coupe is made with Dewar’s White Label scotch, D’ussé cognac, St-Germain, green cardamom pods, fresh lemon juice and Angostura bitters. The addition of aromatic cardamom was inspired by Vengroff’s time spent in Mumbai, India, and a playful green-apple fan provides the finishing touch.

mix.how: Smash the green cardamom pods and add them into a shaker.
Add the rest of the ingredients and ice and shake.
Double-strain into a coupe.

drinkName.name: Mangapeño
drinkName.about: The spicy Mangapeño put Enzo Cangemi on the map. Inspired both by his early years in Los Angeles and his Italian heritage, the Mangapeño combines Grey Goose Vodka, Aperol, mango syrup, lemon juice and a slice of muddled jalapeño.

mix.how: Shake with ice and strain into a coupe.

drinkName.name: Southernmost State of Mind
drinkName.about: While in Chicago for his Bar Shift, Gui Jaroschy scored local lemongrass and marigolds for his signature cocktail while exploring Millennium Park. A sunny glass of Bacardi Heritage, lime juice and a kaffir-citrus cordial mixed with rosemary and St-Germain, the Southernmost State of Mind personified Jaroschy’s native Miami perfectly.

ingredients.ingredient: Sunshine Mix (kaffir and citrus cordial mixed with rosemary and St-Germain)

mix.how: Shake first 3 ingredients and strain into collins glass with collins spear ice if possible.
Drop thin sliced clementine wheel inside glass, top with soda, and garnish rim with another clementine wheel and a sprig of rosemary.

drinkName.name: Buttery Nipple
drinkName.about: Build drink directly in glass.

mix.how: Pour buttershots liqueur into a chilled shot glass.
Carefully layer the rest of the glass with Irish cream.

drinkName.name: Savory Eyeballs
drinkName.about: These eyeballs will give your guests—and cocktails—a scary night to remember.

ingredients.ingredient: Small green or black olives, chopped

mix.how: With a small paring knife, hollow out a small hole in the cocktail onion.
Insert a piece of olive into the cocktail onion (with additional cutting to make sure it fits).
Dip a toothpick into the red food dye and trace along the cocktail onion to create veins.
Place the onions in the freezer for 5 to 10 minutes to set the dye, then slip into a cocktail.

drinkName.name: Chai Tea Fizz
drinkName.about: You won’t find this grown-up chai latte at Starbucks.

mix.how: Shake all with ice for a minute.
Serve long without ice and top with soda.
Garnish with lemon swath.
Shake and serve over cracked ice frappe in white wine glass.
Garnish with large grapefruit swath and small pinch of cinnamon.
Stir all in mixing glass and serve on a large cube in Yarai rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

ingredients.ingredient: Pear liqueur – can sub for fresh pear Juice or nectar(0.75 oz)

mix.how: Shake all with ice and serve in a double rocks glass with ice.
Garnish with lemon swath and pear fan.

drinkName.name: Matador Norteño
drinkName.about: A few drops of habanero tincture transform this sotol-and-pineapple cocktail—for the better.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich agave syrup (2 parts agave nectar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Schlitzie
drinkName.about: This spicy serrano-infused cocktail can be made with interchangeable base spirits like tequila or rye whiskey.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe.

drinkName.name: Cold Comfort
drinkName.about: This autumnal cocktail from Chicago’s Sable Kitchen & Bar head bartender John Stanton pairs bourbon with black walnut–rosemary syrup.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: First Frost
drinkName.about: Despite its chilly temperature, this brandy cocktail offers warming notes of spice-infused vermouth, maple syrup and cardamom.

mix.how: Add Concord grapes to a shaker and muddle.
Add remaining ingredients to the shaker with a small amount of crushed ice and whip shake.
Pour into a Julep glass and top with crushed ice.
Garnish with grated cinnamon and nutmeg, cinnamon stick, lavender and frozen Concord grapes.

drinkName.name: Train’s A Comin’
drinkName.about: In celebration of New York’s historic 7 subway line extension, this cocktail salutes the purple route emblem of the 7 train and marries essential characteristics of the Sazerac and Aviation.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and double strain into an absinthe-rinsed glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: The Bacchus
drinkName.about: Pisco is a natural partner for Concord grapes, which are muddled along with blackberries to create this frothy coupe.

mix.how: Place the Concord grapes and blackberries in a shaker and muddle.
Add the rest of the ingredients and ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe.
Garnish with Concord grapes and lemon peel twisted to release oils.

drinkName.name: Tippy Cow Halloween Layered Shooters: Mint Chocolate Moo

mix.how: Layering trick: Pour first flavor into shot glass.
Shake second flavor vigorously for 10 seconds with ice then pour over spoon into glass.

drinkName.name: Tippy Cow Halloween Layered Shooters: Toot Toot Tootsie

mix.how: Layering trick: Pour first flavor into shot glass.
Shake second flavor vigorously for 10 seconds with ice then pour over spoon into glass.

drinkName.name: Tippy Cow Halloween Layered Shooters: Candy Corn

mix.how: Layering trick: Pour first flavor into shot glass.
Shake second flavor vigorously for 10 seconds with ice then pour over spoon into glass.

drinkName.name: Harvest Moon
drinkName.about: Inspired by the harvest season in late September, this cocktail embodies fall’s coziest flavors.

ingredients.ingredient: Concord grapes soaked in pomegranate molasses brandy and toasted almond

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir vigorously until the mixing glass becomes frosty.
Strain into a rocks glass over two-inch ice cube.

drinkName.name: Mezcal, Concord Grape, Citrus, Market Mint
drinkName.about: Mezcal and Concord grapes? The surprising duo create a smoky, fall-forward cocktail.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe.

drinkName.name: Luminoso
drinkName.about: Concord grapes give this cocktail a clean, crisp autumn flavor while Cocchi Americano and dry vermouth balance out the sweetness of the grape and rosemary syrup.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except club soda to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with Concord grapes and rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: Paper Plane
drinkName.about: A riff on The Last Word cocktail, the Paper Plane is pleasantly easy to remember thanks to its equal parts.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake.
Strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: The Coco Chanel Martini
drinkName.about: This two-ingredient take on the classic Martini is named for the fashion icon.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.

drinkName.name: Concord Grape Margarita
drinkName.about: Concord grapes are perfect for cocktails thanks to their sweetness and pleasantly dry finish. Paired with clean agave flavor from the tequila, Concord grapes create your new favorite flavored Margarita.

ingredients.ingredient: R.W. Knudsen Organic Concord Grape Juice

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and strain over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Back to Capistrano
drinkName.about: Built on a base of malty genever and pisco, this cocktail gains warm fall flavor from homemade Demerara and cinnamon syrups and a handful of Concord grapes.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker.
Shake, and strain over a glass filled with crushed ice.

drinkName.name: Sacred Grape
drinkName.about: Concord grape puree and a homemade basil syrup complete this fizzy gin cocktail.

mix.how: Add the gin, grape puree, basil syrup and lime juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and pour into an Old Fashioned glass.
Top with club soda and garnish with Concord grapes and basil leaves.

drinkName.name: The Purple One
drinkName.about: This pleasantly purple gin cocktail features a fermented Concord grape soda that Bar Tartine makes with local organic grape juice. (At home, you can use a good-quality grape soda like Boylan’s in its place.)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Top with .75 to 1 ounce Concord grape soda.

drinkName.name: Concord Grape Negroni
drinkName.about: The secret ingredient behind this new age Negroni? Concord grape–infused vermouth.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except bitters to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir 45 turns for proper dilution.
Strain contents into a rocks glass and add one large ice cube.
Finish with one dash of lavender bitters.

drinkName.name: Transfusion
drinkName.about: The Transfusion is a golf club standard made with vodka, ginger ale and grape juice. This twist combines homemade ginger syrup with Concord grape juice ice cubes that slowly infuse the drink with fall flavor.

mix.how: Add vodka, ginger syrup and lime juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with Concord grape juice ice cubes.
Top with two ounces club soda and garnish with a Concord grape and piece of crystallized ginger.

drinkName.name: Amai Doku #2
drinkName.about: This soju cocktail’s name translates to “Sweet Poison #2.”

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass.
Top with soda and garnish with half a kumquat.
Pour over ice.
Pour ingredient into cocktail or rocks glass.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker tin, add ingredients and shake.
Strain over ice.
Add ingredients to the mixing glass.
Add ice to mixing glass and stir until cold.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add ingredients (minus the orange peel) into a shaker.
Add ice to shaker tin and shake for 10-15 seconds.
Strain into cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lightly expressed orange peel.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Express the essential oils in the mint and rub them inside the glass.
To the same glass, add simple syrup, bourbon, and crushed ice.
Stir.
Garnish with more ice and fresh mint.
Stir together bourbon, Cointreau and bitters in an ice-filled mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled CHampagne flute.
Top with cold champagne or sparkling wine, and garnish with twist.
Fill mixing glass with ingredients, add ice, and stir gently for 10-15 seconds.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cherry.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Hwayo Vieux Carré
drinkName.about: This take on the New Orleans classic uses popular Korean spirit soju.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Hwayo Negroni
drinkName.about: This take on the classic Italian aperitif uses popular Korean spirit soju instead of gin.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Nail in the Coffin
drinkName.about: This spirit-forward cocktail from San Francisco’s Dirty Habit combines Italian bitter amaro and Portuguese wine with Japanese whisky and Spanish liqueur.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice and stir.
Strain into a Nick & Nora or coupe glass, and garnish with freshly shaved black cardamom.

drinkName.name: Highball Mizuwari
drinkName.about: This Japanese cocktail is all about the whisky—and the ritual. Make sure you count your stirs.

mix.how: Stack several large cubes of ice in a highball glass.
Pour the whisky into the glass and slowly stir it 13 and a half times.
Fill the glass with ice again, and top with sparkling water.
Stir three and a half more times to finish the drink.

drinkName.name: Washington Apple
drinkName.about: This crisp apple and cranberry cocktail is ridiculously easy to drink.

ingredients.ingredient:
Canadian whisky
Try it with Lot 40

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Maryum’s Grass Skirt
drinkName.about: Rum and rye play nicely with rosehip liqueur and pineapple juice in this drink from Atwood Restaurant in Chicago.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Elyx Pineapple
drinkName.about: This picturesque pineapple and vodka concoction is served at Edition Hotels.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a copper pineapple glass or Collins glass over crushed ice.
Garnish with dried pineapple and a sprig of torched rosemary.

drinkName.name: 606 Swizzle
drinkName.about: Sherry, pineapple juice and a rummy homemade mix are the stars of this cocktail from Sable Kitchen & Bar in Chicago.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the pilsner to a hurricane glass filled with crushed ice.
Mix well, and top with pilsner.
Garnish with a mint sprig and 3 dashes of Angostura Bitters.

drinkName.name: Bumboat
drinkName.about: This eclectic cocktail from San Francisco’s Smuggler’s Cove uses pineapple, almond, whiskey and rum.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the 151 to a hollowed out pineapple and fill with crushed ice.
Blend well and float the 151 or Lemon Hart on top.

drinkName.name: Twist My Arm(agnac)
drinkName.about: After one sip of this pineapple-spiked drink from San Francisco’s Dirty Habit, you won’t need any more coaxing.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass over one large ice cube.
Garnish with a compressed pineapple core or a cube of pineapple.

drinkName.name: Piha Spritz
drinkName.about: You can find this pineapple and gin concoction at The Musket Room in New York.

ingredients.ingredient: Tempus Fugit Kina L'Aréo d'Or apéritif

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the sparkling wine to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a wine glass filled with fresh ice and top with the sparkling rosé.
Garnish with a sage flower and/or leaf.

drinkName.name: Al Pachilli
drinkName.about: This fruity cocktail from MAMO in New York gets a hint of spice.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well, and strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Choose-Your-Own-Base-Spirit Piña Colada
drinkName.about: Not a fan of rum? Try this classic tiki drink with Chartreuse instead.

ingredients.ingredient: Base spirit (rum, Green Chartreuse, Campari or mezcal)

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with crushed ice.
Fill the top of the glass with crushed ice and top with nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Snake Bit Sprout
drinkName.about: Chamomile gin and pineapple juice? This cocktail from Houston cocktail bar Julep is delightfully unexpected.

mix.how: Add all ingredients except the apple cider to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh crushed ice.
Fill the top of the glass with crushed ice and layer the apple cider on top.
Garnish with chamomile buds and serve with a long straw.
Add ingredients to the mixing glass.
Add ice to mixing glass and serving glass.
Stir ingredients for 30-40 seconds.
Strain into serving glass.
Garnish with a lightly expressed orange peel.
Add water and sugar to a small saucepan over medium heat.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Let cool, then stir in the vanilla extract.
Strain into a jar or bottle and seal tightly with a lid.

ingredients.ingredient: DEWAR’S WHITE LABEL Blended Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Muddle the lemon, mint and simple syrup in the bottom of a mixing glass.
Add DEWAR’S, shake and strain into a Collins glass filled with crushed ice.
Top with seltzer water.

drinkName.name: Tepache Mode
drinkName.about: The secret to this summery cocktail? Tepache liqueur, based on the traditional Mexican beverage that’s made with fermented pineapple, unrefined brown sugar and spices.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake, and strain into Martini glass.
Garnish with freshly-grated cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Sin Nombre
drinkName.about: The secret ingredient in this blushing glass? A hint of refreshing aloe vera juice.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well.
Strain contents into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with an orange or lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Miss Me Not
drinkName.about: A fresh celery and sugar snap pea syrup brightens this tequila-based Highball, complete with an absinthe mist.

ingredients.ingredient: Celery and sugar snap pea syrup*

mix.how: Combine Don Julio Blanco Tequila, sherry, fresh lemon juice, celery and sugar snap pea syrup into a shaker with ice. Shake well.
Strain contents into a highball glass over ice and top with seltzer. Garnish with mint sprig and absinthe mist.

drinkName.name: Pils al Pastor
drinkName.about: Ancho chile liqueur, tart drinking vinegar and a cap of Pilsner give this cocktail its fizzy kick.

mix.how: Combine Don Julio Blanco Tequila, ancho chile liqueur, fresh lime juice and Pok Pok Pineapple drinking vinegar in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well.
Strain contents into a rocks glass rimmed with La Boite 37 Spice and Salt blend over ice. Top with Pilsner.

drinkName.name: Grapefruit Sazerac
drinkName.about: Grapefruit adds a welcome citrus note to this New Orleans specialty.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Stir for approximately eight seconds.
Spray absinthe into a cocktail glass with a spritzer. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with grapefruit peel.

drinkName.name: Maple Leaf
drinkName.about: Vanilla bean, maple and bourbon compliment each other in this heart-warming concoction.

ingredients.ingredient:
Bourbon
Try it with Jefferson\\\'s Kentucky Straight

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake for approximately 12 seconds.
Strain into a chilled Nick and Nora glass and garnish with vanilla bean.

drinkName.name: Hanalei Sun
drinkName.about: This infusion makes a fast-as-lightning cocktail. Just let pineapple chunks and rum hang out together for a few days. Then shake, strain and sip.

ingredients.ingredient: Pineapple, peeled, cored, and cut into one-inch pieces
750 ml bottle Vodka or white rum

mix.how: Place the pineapple pieces and the vodka or rum in a large nonreactive metal or glass container with a lid. Cover and let sit for one week in the refrigerator, stirring it once a day.

Strain the liquid through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl, allowing the fruit to sit in the strainer for 30 minutes so as to get all the liquid. Discard the fruit and funnel the infusion back into the original bottle and label. The infusion will keep for two weeks in the refrigerator.
To serve, pour 3 ½ ounces of the pineapple infusion into a shaker and shake with ice until chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a pineapple wedge.

drinkName.name: Suey’s Sangrita
drinkName.about: Julie Reiner sees the value in drinking tequila straight. If you want to have your cake and eat it too, pair your bottle with her recipe for Sangrita, a tomato-based citrus concoction that can be enjoyed on the side.

ingredients.ingredient: Jalapeño, sliced in half and seeded (leave the seeds in for a spicier Sangrita)

mix.how: In a pitcher, combine the jalapeño, juices, Tabasco, Cholula, salt, paprika and pepper.
Stir, cover, and let the mixture sit in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Remove the jalapeño.
To serve, pour five ounces of the Sangrita into a Collins glass filled with ice and serve alongside a two-ounce shot of blanco tequila.

drinkName.name: NOLET’S Bramble
drinkName.about: This gin cocktail from Tim Wells of Chicago’s Revival Social Club gets a seriously fruity twist with pomegranate syrup and raspberry liqueur.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake hard for 10 seconds, and strain into a Double Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon slice and fresh basil leaves.

drinkName.name: Liquor.com’s Piña Colada
drinkName.about: The chilly, coconut-y drink is having (another) delicious moment. And this recipe might be the best there is.

ingredients.ingredient: Dark rum (recommended: Don Q Anejo Rum)

mix.how: Pour all ingredients into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well for a good 30 seconds or so. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a wedge of fresh pineapple.

drinkName.name: The Inside Scoop
drinkName.about: You’ve never tasted a root beer float this good.

mix.how: Spray a rocks glass with Yellow Chartreuse. Add the Jägermeister and root beer to the rocks glass. Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Dash the bitters on top of the ice cream. Express an orange peel over top and discard.
